Participants.evidence: 141 patients with severe hemorrhoids were included

Intervention.evidence: the TST group, the pieces per hour the PPH group, and the eastern rubber band ligation and coincident of dislocation for prolapse and hemorrhoid (EPH)group

Objective.evidence: To assess the ability of tissue-selective therapy stapler (TST) minimally invasive surgery to treat severe hemorrhoids

Method_Outcome.evidence: The clinical efficacy of the three groups of patients, changes in hospital stay time, operation time, intraoperative blood loss, postoperative complications, and anal dynamic indicators

Number_Randomised.evidence: 141 patients with severe hemorrhoids were included into three groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: The total effective rate in the TST group was 93.62%, which was higher than the 74.47% and 72.34% in the PPH and EPH groups

Harms.evidence: the complication rate in the TST group was 10.64%, which was lower than the 27.66% and 31.91% reported in the PPH and EPH groups
